1.text: You therefore, my child, be strengthened in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

2.text: The things which you have heard from me among many witnesses, commit the same to faithful men, who will be able to teach others also.

3.text: You therefore must endure hardship, as a good soldier of Christ Jesus.

4.text: No soldier on duty entangles himself in the affairs of life, that he may please him who enrolled him as a soldier.

5.text: Also, if anyone competes in athletics, he isn’t crowned unless he has competed by the rules.

6.text: The farmers who labor must be the first to get a share of the crops.

7.text: Consider what I say, and may the Lord give you understanding in all things.

8.text: Remember Jesus Christ, risen from the dead, of the seed of David, according to my Good News,

9.text: in which I suffer hardship to the point of chains as a criminal. But God’s word isn’t chained.

10.text: Therefore I endure all things for the chosen ones’ sake, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

11.text: This saying is faithful: “For if we died with him, we will also live with him.

12.text: If we endure, we will also reign with him. If we deny him, he also will deny us.

13.text: If we are faithless, he remains faithful. He can’t deny himself.”

14.text: Remind them of these things, charging them in the sight of the Lord, that they don’t argue about words, to no profit, to the subverting of those who hear.

15.text: Give diligence to present yourself approved by God, a workman who doesn’t need to be ashamed, properly handling the Word of Truth.

16.text: But shun empty chatter, for it will go further in ungodliness,

17.text: and those words will consume like gangrene, of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus;

18.text: men who have erred concerning the truth, saying that the resurrection is already past, and overthrowing the faith of some.

19.text: However God’s firm foundation stands, having this seal, “The Lord knows those who are his,” and, “Let every one who names the name of the Lord depart from unrighteousness.”

20.text: Now in a large house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of clay. Some are for honor, and some for dishonor.

21.text: If anyone therefore purges himself from these, he will be a vessel for honor, sanctified, and suitable for the master’s use, prepared for every good work.

22.text: Flee from youthful lusts; but pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.

23.text: But refuse foolish and ignorant questionings, knowing that they generate strife.

24.text: The Lord’s servant must not quarrel, but be gentle towards all, able to teach, patient,

25.text: in gentleness correcting those who oppose him: perhaps God may give them repentance leading to a full knowledge of the truth,

26.text: and they may recover themselves out of the devil’s snare, having been taken captive by him to his will.
